definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: When putt in place, the block stones shall be bigger-face up with joints staggered.
sentences.chinese: 擺放塊石時，石料應大面向上，縫隙相互錯開。

sentences.english: Layered construction, seam position should be staggered with each other.
sentences.chinese: 分層施工時，留縫位置應互相錯開。

sentences.english: They planned to stagger our rehearsing hours.
sentences.chinese: 他們打算錯開我們的排演時間。

sentences.english: Can consider whether to stagger off the North and the South?
sentences.chinese: 是否可以考慮南北方錯開休假？

sentences.english: Both of them were offset by large-sized sinistral move of the Tanlou fault in Mesozoic.
sentences.chinese: 郯廬斷裂帶中生代大規模左行平移使兩者錯開。

sentences.english: Screw hollow and motor spindle are distributed staggered and equally.
sentences.chinese: 螺紋安裝孔的位置與電裝電機軸線成錯開對稱分佈。

sentences.english: To stagger the interfaces of tape and plate.
sentences.chinese: 膠帶的介面應與版材的介面錯開。

sentences.english: Restaurants and spas staggered hours to reduce staffing.
sentences.chinese: 餐館和溫泉的營業時間相互錯開，以便減少人手。

definition: to avoid/to evade/to keep away from
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
